Reviews.Title: Excellent Value!!!
Reviews.Author: RP
Reviews.Content: My LG GS170 phone was bought at Walmart for a lower price (christmas pricing). In Package: Comes with power cord (recharging) and a T Mobile sim card (you have to call TMobile to activate your prepaid phone line and the sim card). Or you can get your own phone line with another carrier (they will require their own sim card).The phone is more of a backup phone (than my primary phone), but it is REALLY easy to use. The speaker is nice and loud, speaker phone is on the middle black button, speed dial, volume control are very easy to use. Yes, the manual/user's guide doesn't really start till page 23, but using the phone for the first time is very intuitive and easy to set up. The Red Phone button on the right gets you back to the main screen. To dial, just punch in the phone number (xxx-xxx-xxxx) and press the Green Phone button on the left - very easy!Opening the phone is a bit difficult (for a person with no nails), but otherwise the phone is quite stylish. Outside window: Caller ID, time of day/date (when you press the volume buttons). To "silence" the phone, open it, then press the up or down volume buttons to either raise the ring volume or lower it to "vibrate" or "silence all".Texting/messaging is impossible because it has three letters to a button, so i would not recommend it if you are a texter. The internet is in "Web2go" (the globe on the upper right when you hit the "menu" button) - also a bit difficult (and incredibly small screen) to use. I does have a camera, but i haven't used it yet.But for a good/strong backup phone for just voice calling, this can be a good little phone. Or for a backup phone for your vehicle etc..its probably 4-5 year old technology, but so is your car's technology, so what the heck! I was originally going to return the little red phone when my "real phone" gets delivered (from Amazon), but i'm starting to really like the simplicity of this little phone, so i will keep it as a backup (to my new whizz-bang smartphone, which this is NOT). Haven't had one problem with reception anywhere, and the antenae seems very strong in all kinds of scenarios (urban, suburban, airport, roadside etc).This is a T MOBILE phone only. It will not work on any other network.

Reviews.Title: MY Phone
Reviews.Author: Wendy V Brejot
Reviews.Content: This is a copy of my review for the regular version.Some people on other sites said that they didn't like it because you need a USB cable to download/upload photos to/from thier computers.Well not a problem for me. The only 1 photo I have on my phone is of my cat. I use it as my wallpaper. I got this phone to make/recieve calls. Not to take pics.I just got this phone yesterday 10-16-2011. So far so goood.The owner's manual leaves something to be desired. It dosen't state how long to charge the battery. (I went online to find out.)I was able to set up my account,voice mail and other stuff with ease.The speakers and mike sound clear. The screan is easy to see and clean. I also like that it has Caller ID on the top flap so you can see who's calling before you answer.You also get a choice of plans. Pay as you go or one of T-Mobile's monthly subscriptions. Right now I chose pay as you go. I also have the choce to upgrade to another plan later if I want to. That's great.PS For all you cell phone charm addicts. YES this has a little loop for attaching charms.-----------------------------------Update March 3,2013I had this phone for  about 2 years. I lost it recently and had to replace it with an AT&T; Go phone.I had great coverage while I had but there was one thing that annoyed me. Texting on this thing was BAD. I had to keep pressing the keys over and over just get a particular letter.

Reviews.Title: Love this Phone
Reviews.Author: Cole
Reviews.Content: I recommend this phone for people who want a simple, small cell that can be used right out of the box with a very small learning curve to it.  The LG-GS170 is an excellent choice for those that have never used a smartphone, and want an easy phone that has the ability to have some features you would like to try for short money.I have only had this for less than one month, but have taken it out of state and it did not let me down.  I will follow up this review if anything changes.To date, it is my favorite basic phone to recommend and use.  I have not had any issues at all with dropped calls as another reviewer mentioned. Sounds to me they received a defective one.Here are the Pros that I have found with zero cons:The battery life for me has been excellent.Extremely user friendlyVery easy for those that are non-tech.Large keypad.Clarity on both ends of callslarge keypad.

Reviews.Title: Dreadful, awful phone
Reviews.Author: DallasWriter "DallasWriter"
Reviews.Content: I've had this phone for about a month, and have hated it for almost all of that time.  I got it because I'm not ready to spend tons of money on a smartphone. So, yes, I get that it's basic. But this is easily the worst phone I've had in all my years of using cell phones, and it was a waste of money.- The text user interface is insane. On other similar phones, when you type a combination of letters using the T9 dictionary, it offers you the most common word. If that isn't what you're looking for, in other phones you can use the arrow keys to scroll through alternative words. Not this phone. You have to backspace over the wrong word, use a MENU to change to the alpha mode, then type in the word you want, then change back to the T9 mode.- It routinely skips telling you that you have messages. If you're getting a cell phone to actually know when you have text messages or voicemail, you might want to keep looking.- The wakeup alarm function also works erratically (at best). Cross your fingers that it doesn't decide not to work on the day of your big job interview.- It drops calls -- often.- A minor annoyance: When you turn up the volume, it rings to demonstrate the corresponding volume. The ringer during this function has to be the most irritating ring available; and I don't think any of my Samsung phones (the kind I've mostly had in the past) rang loudly when I turned up the volume.Just an awful phone.(I really wish people would use a product for more than a day before giving the product a great review. The point of reviews is to help others make informed decisions, and you aren't informed after one day of use. I wish someone had warned me about this phone.)

Reviews.Title: Another Of Many, None Are Great.
Reviews.Author: An Ikearat's Brain "Tom"
Reviews.Content: This is an old phone, no longer in production. This review is more of a rant than a useful review as I'm sure the number of people considering this phone is extremely limited. Read-on if you are looking for the details I seem to care about.The vendor, UniqueBuys did a great job, delivering exactly what they offered and ahead of schedule.I have been ordering inexpensive little phones all Summer trying to find one that has fewer issues than the others.The LG GS170 (T-Mobile branded) scores about even with the other phones I have.So far, the best one has been the Samsung SGH-A107 (not as many features, but well designed and with good software).The good:It's about the right size.It has enough features to entertain you as well as make it through the day.It's built solid enough to be a daily-use phone.It looks nice (with exception to the composition of the case coating).It uses a "standard" USB connector for recharging. (some data services are available through this connection, you have to use Bluetooth for file and picture transfer. There is no iSync of addresses of calendar information).The bad:- It is slow, the software is asking too much from the little processor, result is the menus are slow and there's some lag between the press of a key and a result.- If you use your own Wallpaper image you are penalized by having to wait up to two seconds for the soft-keys on the screen to appear after opening the flip. (Menu & Options)- The display power management has been co-opted to serve the vendor and not the customer. Power is wasted displaying useless stuff on the external display while you use the phone for a call. (you are a walking billboard for LG)- The software is not logically ordered. It takes several key presses to reach commonly used features and stuff you will have little use for has been "pushed forward" by T-Mobile in an attempt to get you to use services. (this is common of "branded" phones, so you get what you pay for in this respect) Even with special keys for Messages and the camera, there are still hoops to jump through where other implementations (other phones) are better at serving the features than on this phone.- A press of the side key(s) to activate the external display is buffered and processed after the display lights. Result is, the Date is displayed a fraction of a second after the display becomes active requiring a second key press to return showing the Time. The Time does show after a delay in which you must stare at the phone or miss the Time readout before the display goes dark again.- The 4-way pad and center button are flat and feature no tactile clues. You can not feel the center button and none of it is back lighted. In low-light locations, it is very hard to use features involving the 4-way and center button.- The casing, while strong is noisy. Handling the phone produces crackling sounds that your friends will complain about while you are on a call. The speaker-phone feature might have been an afterthought addressing this problem.The Ugly:- The phone is coated in a rubber-like substance that attracts dirt and pocket fluff like a magnet. You can not simply wipe the phone down with a cloth as the surface clings to cloth and pulls additional debris from the cloth adding to the mess. The only way I have found to clean the phone is to wipe it with a damp lint-free camera lens cloth and then air-dry it on the counter top. Most other plastic cell phones can be cleaned simply by wiping with your t-shirt. Also, in my experience this kind of coating will decompose into a sticky mess after a year or so of handling. Ever touch a Ryobi cordless drill? It's like that.- The file system is "broken" in that should you install a file with an extension the phone does not recognize, the only way to delete the file is a Master Reset (Master Reset access code is 0000 <that's four zeros> I had to search this so here it is for you to use). You can not even delete the file through Bluetooth, the delete Bluetooth message returns a bad command error message. Be careful, you can fill-up the phone's memory with crap and have to do a Master Reset to clear it all out.- As with most of these phones, the camera is only slightly better than simply drawing a picture of what you see for yourself.Pictures taken with the phone are not the same aspect ratio or file size as images to be used for Wallpaper so all your pictures will have a white border in them if you try to use them as Wallpaper. Loading an image through Bluetooth works, but you -must- be careful or you end-up with an incorrect file size or a bad file extension that the phone does not recognize. Hello Master Reset :)I have returned to using my Samsung A107, this LG T-Mobile branded phone is not "good enough" to take-up any more of my time.p.s. People have asked my why I don't use an iPhone, "you can afford it, hell you buy all those little crap phones!"The reasons are many and some trivial but the bottom line is, I don't want a cell phone draining my time with trivial pursuits. I have no need of games on a tiny screen and I can remember 99% of the phone numbers and other information I need through the day.What I want is analogous to a pocket pay phone. I want to be able to make/receive a call and occasionally send/receive a text message. What's so hard about that? It seems to me cell phone manufacturers fail at the core of their calling.Thanks for reading, I feel better now :)

Reviews.Title: I love this thing!
Reviews.Author: Daren
Reviews.Content: Charming, simple, and forward. That isn't the only advantage a flip phone gives you, but also particularly in this model's software.So far I've:-Received very clear calls-Never missed a call due to this phone's surprisingly loud speakerphone-Sent picture messages with the greatest of ease (the phone gives you several options to do with your picture after you take it)-Sent this phone through hell and back (dropped it 19898464 times)-Set up alarms that never fail to wake me up in the most abnormal of schedules (8:40 AM every Mondays and Wednesdays, 6:40 AM every Tuesdays and Thursdays, 5:00 AM every Friday, and backup alarms five minutes after every alarm set)-Set up phone 'profiles' that are customized for very particular preferences, such as vibrating calls and silent messages for my "Office" profile and Loud, vibrating calls, and loud, vibrating messages for my "Home" profile.-Deleted my entire message inbox at once (contrary to what a 2 star review said you can't do with this phone)-Tossed it at my cousin who was pissing me off.There are plenty of other features this phone can do that I never would've expected when I purchased this under the guise of a cheapo temporary phone. The innovation and conveniences behind the the software this underrated FLIP phone carries more than fulfills my daily needs. 5 STARS!

Reviews.Title: Nice simple minimal phone
Reviews.Author: Randolph Morris
Reviews.Content: I got this phone because I want a simple phone for voice only and a long battery life. That is what I got. Battery life is excellent so far. Last over a week with reasonable voice usage. Hopefully the longevity of the battery charge will last a while. The rest of the features are crappy if compared to modern smart phone features of course.

Reviews.Title: Lousy reception
Reviews.Author: Todd A
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews and thought that this would be a good basic phone to replace the one my wife had dropped and broken. Perhaps it was a defective phone but it would not pick up signal even close to useful or the flip phone it replaced. Not usable in any real sense of the word. The seller was great and very responsive to emails and the subsequent return so I would purchase from them with no reservations.

Reviews.Title: Crappy phone!
Reviews.Author: Satisfied Customer
Reviews.Content: The phone looks nice and pretty, but it actually is a piece of junk!  It worked for several days (20 some days) but all of a sudden it decided not to "make any sounds"!!!  No ring tones, can't hear or talk on the phone which means it can't be used as a "PHONE"!!!  Worse of all, I tried to contact the seller to request an explanation or a refund since it was still within a month but they didn't even bother to write me back!  It's a CHEAP pnone ($29.99), but as one of the Amazon's loyal customers, I think I deserve at least an explanation!!!

Reviews.Title: BEST PHONE I EVER HAD!!!!
Reviews.Author: balwinder
Reviews.Content: No joke I am a Stanford student and have gone through many iphones and androids and have yet to find a phone like this. Battery life is amazing, service is great and its super durable. No other comments.You will be a fool not to buy it.

Reviews.Title: I hate this piece of junk
Reviews.Author: David Kirkpatrick "Whammo77"
Reviews.Content: My Nokia went haywire and I needed another flip phone in a hurry. I grabbed this one at Walmart. I wish I never had. Here are the things I don't like about it...1) The exterior screen is tinted. When in daylight or very well lit rooms, you cannot see who is calling when a call comes in.2) The idiot who designed this thing placed the "Off" button right above the #3 button. Therefore, while on a call with an automated system, it is very easy to press OFF instead of #3 (if prompted to do so). This, obviously, ends your call. I have had this happen numerous times!!!! Sometimes after being on hold for what seemed like forever! How annoying! This same problem also occurs if/when texting. If you are trying to type a D, E, or F (again the #3 key), it's easy to clip the "Off" button which sends your text immediately to the Drafts folder. Ugh. Had this happen way too many times to count.3) On my Nokia you could customize the keys. Not on this POS!!!4) The functions (such as the Alarm) work if and when they feel like it. Don't count on it for an alarm. The alarm on mine goes off about once a week, despite the fact that it is set to go off daily. It pretty much does what it wants.5) My old phone had easy shortcuts. Not this one!6) My old phone actually had 'real' emoticons. This one has the old fashion crap such as :-)  Come on.....As for what I do like about it:1) I have dropped it off ladders and it continued working. Seems fairly durable.2) The battery life on it FAR exceeds my old Nokias. I have never had a Nokia that I could get more than about 8 hours of use out of, and had to be very sparing about using them. I always carried a charger with me with all of my previous Nokia phones. I have actually gotten a full 2 days out of this thing. That does surprise me.....I guess if you are like 60, have little fingers, and just want to call your grand kids once in a while, this thing is ok. If you want a phone you will use for a lot of texting, I would NOT recommend this thing. If you have to call a lot of automated systems, I would not recommend this thing. If you work in a rough environment (such as construction) and need a fairly durable phone, I guess I would recommend it.Overall, I just don't like this thing and curse it at least 5 times a day......

Reviews.Title: good back up phone; horrible daily use phone
Reviews.Author: Lauren N. Gam
Reviews.Content: This phone works okay for voice calls. The best feature about this phone is the speakerphone. The speakerphone is very loud which is helpful. The phone is also very durable, I have dropped it many times.The feature that has earned this phone a 2 star rating is the in efficiency of the Text Message inbox feature. Before I changed the settings on the phone I was having to erase the inbox and the sent box one message at a time. There is an option where you can choose to not have the sent messages saved.Deleting each text message I receive in my inbox one by one is such a hassle.

Reviews.Title: Basic but Awesome
Reviews.Author: Linda M.
Reviews.Content: I have had this phone for 2 years, I have dropped it in a creek, kicked it across the floor, dumped it in sand, and still it runs. Holds a charge for 4 days too. Nothing fancy, but so dependable. 6 months later, I RAN OVER IT with my car! Still works.

Reviews.Title: Item OK, shipping OK
Reviews.Author: Theodore Cohen "Author, reporter"
Reviews.Content: It is not a great phone, but it is adequate if you need a basic phone. Like the call-block option.though it limits how you can block calls.

Reviews.Title: good phone for being made in china came with supplies
Reviews.Author: james k goss
Reviews.Content: long battery good signal strength, easy for moms to use. good phone for being china made. t mobile don't sell these phones no more

Reviews.Title: T-MOBILE PHONE
Reviews.Author: Julie Neff
Reviews.Content: I got the phone for a friend to replace the previous phone which got damaged.  Was a great deal.  Thanks

Reviews.Title: You don't get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: RobS
Reviews.Content: I signed up for a T-Mobile pay as you go phone because I don't use my phone much and they have the best per minute rate of all the carriers. The downside is you pay for the phone up front, unlike the last phone we got from Verizon for signing a new contract. The network coverage is nowhere as strong as my wife's LG Accolade Verizon phone, especially in fringe areas. The selection of basic phones on T-Mobile pay as you go plans are awful, bottom of the barrel types, and customer service is a tier below acceptable. But this review is for the phone, so on to it...As a basic phone, it makes calls, and the battery life is good. Calls in a good coverage area are clear. Also, the phone doesn't turn itself off randomly like the Samsung phone it replaced. The downside is the screen - small size, low resolution, and tiny icons make it impossible to use without my cheater glasses. It's also not very customizable. Photos are just OK. I don't text or use multimedia or web, so no comment on that.

Reviews.Title: Wife's phone
Reviews.Author: Jeffery Carmelle
Reviews.Content: My wife does not want a smart phone and found that this LG phone fit her needs well. She likes the ease of use.

Reviews.Title: Durable and dependable
Reviews.Author: Fan
Reviews.Content: This is our second LG GS170.  The first one we constantly abuse for three or four years. It still worked even though the hinges were broke.  So, we went with what we trusted -- the LG GS170

Reviews.Title: Easy to Use
Reviews.Author: wordluvr
Reviews.Content: This phone is a gift for my 80's something friend who has never used a cell phone. This phone is inexpensive and easy to use. Even though it is small, the keypad keys are large enough for her to see and use. The phone will probably be used as a phone only although it has a camera and web functionality. As long as it does not malfunction, I think my friend will be pleased.

Reviews.Title: Great for Seniors
Reviews.Author: mermiz "Jean S Simon"
Reviews.Content: Flip phones are great for Seniors.This phone is simple, light, easy to use and carry.Many seniors can't handle a complex cell phone.  This one is easy!  Just open to answer calls and close to end them.Dialing shows big numbers on the screen, easy for seniors to read, or scroll down for address book numbers.

Reviews.Title: I like it
Reviews.Author: Autumn
Reviews.Content: The most I like this product is the color, flipping cover, and hands-free headset (it’s a very important for me, but the later product package does not include this part anymore).  It’s easy to use; the small size is convenient to carry around (comparing with the smart phone). What I dislike is the price. It’s more expensive than the similar phones.

Reviews.Title: happy customer
Reviews.Author: L. MARC WINTER
Reviews.Content: Great phone if, like myself, you wish to keep it simple. I have reception when people around me with high $ phones have no service.

Reviews.Title: GREAT PHONE, CUSTOM RINGTONES, OTHERS ARE EXPERIENCING USER ERRORS!!
Reviews.Author: J. Freberg "frvrgtfl"
Reviews.Content: I had this phone for about 2 years. This is the first phone I've ever had that lasted nearly that long. PLEASE NOTE!!: The reviewers giving this phone poor reviews are complaining about issues that are caused by USER ERROR!! This phone's T9 text interface is great! You can scroll through other word choices using the *(star) key. This phone is extremely durable. It has been though fire (literally melted part of the shell of the phone) and water (the rice trick did the job wonderfully). I especially love the volume of the ringer. I am able to create my own .mp3 format ringtones (I take a 30 second clip of my favorite song). I bluetooth the file from my laptop to the phone and select use as ringtone (ringer volume must be on for this to work. Just take the phone of silent before you send the file. otherwise save the file, then turn off silent, and then go set the ringtone manually in the phone's profile setting). The vibration on the phone is very strong, which is nice because you can feel it easier. The battery life on this phone is exceptional! I can go a solid 4 days without charging and I text a lot.

Reviews.Title: MEH
Reviews.Author: missa
Reviews.Content: Bought this after husband broke his third phone, worked ok. Not great signal and screen really small! Buttons are cery small too not recommended for a man!

Reviews.Title: ElectroMiami Electronics
Reviews.Author: L. Goldstein "Unhappy Customer"
Reviews.Content: They sent me a used phone.They waited for the warranty to expire.I never got my money or a new phone.Beware of the losers!

Reviews.Title: problems, problems, problems
Reviews.Author: LeniA
Reviews.Content: Problems with the ring not working. Problems with the alarm not working. Problems with other sound files. Don't buy this.

Reviews.Title: Really dislike
Reviews.Author: Denise
Reviews.Content: I got this phone because it was cheap and because I hardly spend any time on the phone anyway.  Problem is... it won't let me text - that is, it's such a pain to try I stopped, because whenever I hit something wrong it kept asking me to save to drafts (or sent it - even worse!)  I'm not that stupid with a phone,  my last phone was fine - type - send - no problem.  I don't think there should be such a learning process for texting on a stupid $20 phone.It also won't set to ring and vibrate at the same time.  It's one or the other unlike my last phone, and I'd like the option of both.  On the plus side, it does have a decently loud ringer and vibrate.I'm possibly starting to get some battery / connection issues, although it might be my imagination I'm going to keep an eye on things.  If I do need another, it sure won't be this one!

Reviews.Title: I hate it, I hate it
Reviews.Author: David Kirkpatrick "Whammo77"
Reviews.Content: My Nokia went haywire and I needed another flip phone in a hurry. I grabbed this one at Walmart. I wish I never had. I have had this thing for about 2 months.Here are the things I don't like about it...1) The exterior screen is tinted. When in daylight or very well lit rooms, you cannot see who is calling when a call comes in.2) The idiot who designed this thing placed the "Off" button right above the #3 button. Therefore, while on a call with an automated system, it is very easy to press OFF instead of #3 (if prompted to do so). This, obviously, ends your call. I have had this happen numerous times!!!! Sometimes after being on hold for what seemed like forever! How annoying! This same problem also occurs if/when texting. If you are trying to type a D, E, or F (again the #3 key), it's easy to clip the "Off" button which sends your text immediately to the Drafts folder. Ugh. Had this happen way too many times to count.3) On my Nokia you could customize the keys. Not on this POS!!!4) The functions (such as the Alarm) work if and when they feel like it. Don't count on it for an alarm. The alarm on mine goes off about once a week, despite the fact that it is set to go off daily. It pretty much does what it wants.5) My old phone had easy shortcuts. Not this one!6) My old phone actually had 'real' emoticons. This one has the old fashion crap such as :-) Come on.....7) Sometimes it notifies me when I get a text. Sometimes it doesn't.8) Sometimes it forgets to ring when a call comes in.9) The T9 on this thing is horrible. The words it chooses make no sense. For example: When you try to type the word "had", it comes up with "ice". Now really, which word do you think you are going to use more????? With my Nokia you could use the spell function and save the word you use more and it would place it "at the front" of your choices. Not this stupid thing. No matter how many times I have saved the word "had", it still gives me "ice" as my first choice. Ugh.As for what I do like about it:1) I have dropped it off ladders and it continued working. Seems fairly durable.2) The battery life on it FAR exceeds my old Nokias. I have never had a Nokia that I could get more than about 8 hours of use out of, and had to be very sparing about using them. I always carried a charger with me with all of my previous Nokia phones. I have actually gotten a full 2 days out of this thing. That does surprise me.....I guess if you are like 60, have little fingers, and just want to call your grand kids once in a while, this thing is ok. If you want a phone you will use for a lot of texting, I would NOT recommend this thing. If you have to call a lot of automated systems, I would not recommend this thing. If you work in a rough environment (such as construction) and need a fairly durable phone just to get you through the work day, I guess I would recommend it.Overall, I just don't like this thing and curse it at least 5 times a day......

Reviews.Title: Just what I ordered!
Reviews.Author: Naomi Lagasse
Reviews.Content: My husband and I  have had a T-Mobile phone plan for ~10 years, so do all my grown children.  We talk to each other using the free T-Mobile to T-Mobile plan.  Anyway, another phone broke, instead of renewing a contract every time a new phone is needed, we buy one from Amazon.  Works well for us, we appreciate the ability to buy one when we need one.  There is a big selection to choose from and prices and shipping are set at a shoppers bargain.

Reviews.Title: Phone & charger great !
Reviews.Author: Karl Bretz  kb
Reviews.Content: This is just what I orderer,I am pleased with the fact that it was new in the box, as for the battery life is a bit short , It works fine. It arrived prior to it deadline date, tanks

Reviews.Title: grossly overpriced
Reviews.Author: jedisav
Reviews.Content: this phone only costs 10 dollars, without a plan, if you buy it directly from t-mobile. anyone who pays more than that for this phone, is being ripped off.

Reviews.Title: My dad likes it
Reviews.Author: Vanii92
Reviews.Content: My dad likes it and it has not failed him even when he tends to be very bad with phones. The phone is still fully functional

Reviews.Title: T-Mobile Prepaid LG
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Woods "Marie"
Reviews.Content: This cell was purchased as a gift for my mother. The cell looks good only. It arrived with old text messages and the text features had been changed to shorthand. In addition to this the manual is for another phone. I'm very unhappy!

Reviews.Title: Nice cheap phone
Reviews.Author: Wendy V Brejot
Reviews.Content: Some people on other sites said that they didn't like it because you need a USB cable to download/upload photos to/from thier computers.Well not a problem for me. The only 1 photo I have on my phone is of my cat. I use it as my wallpaper. I got this phone to make/recieve calls. Not to take pics.I just got this phone yesterday 10-16-2011. So far so goood.The owner's manual leaves something to be desired. It dosen't state how long to charge the battery. (I went online to find out.)I was able to set up my account,voice mail and other stuff with ease.The speakers and mike sound clear. The screan is easy to see and clean. I also like that it has Caller ID on the top flap so you can see who's calling before you answer.You also get a choice of plans. Pay as you go or one of T-Mobile's monthly subscriptions. Right now I chose pay as you go. I also have the choce to upgrade to another plan later if I want to. That's great.PS For all you cell phone charm addicts. YES this has a little loop for attaching charms.-----------------------------------Update March 3,2013I had this phone for  about 2 years. I lost it recently and had to replace it with an AT&T; Go phone.I had great coverage while I had it but there was one thing that annoyed me. Texting on this thing was BAD. I had to keep pressing the keys over and over just get a particular letter.

Reviews.Title: does anybody speak english at t-mobile
Reviews.Author: REPTAA "REPTAA"
Reviews.Content: very hard to activate,only a few people at t-mobile speak english...the ones that speak english,like to pass you off to a computer... ever talk to a computer,please repeat sir etc. and etc...

ProductInfo.Features: Always free shipping within the USA
ProductInfo.Name: T-Mobile Prepaid LG GS170 No-Contract Mobile Phone Red
